author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Retrieves incident metadata from Threat Response.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-get-incident

commands.description: Adds comments to an existing Threat Response incident, by incident ID.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-update-incident-comment

commands.description: Ingest an alert into Threat Response.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-ingest-alert

commands.description: Adds the supplied URLs to the specified URL block list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-block-url

commands.description: Deletes an indicator from the specified list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-delete-indicator

commands.description: Adds the supplied IP addresses to the specified IP block list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-block-ip

commands.description: Verify if an email has been quarantined.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-verify-quarantine

commands.description: Gets items for the specified list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-get-list

commands.description: Adds the supplied domains to the specified block list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-block-domain

commands.description: Adds a member to the specified list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-add-to-list

commands.description: Adds the supplied file hashes to the specified file hash block list.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-block-hash

commands.description: Retrieves all incident metadata from Threat Response by specifying filter criteria such as the state of the incident or time of closure.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-list-incidents

commands.description: Returns indicators from the specified list, according to the defined filter.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-search-indicator

commands.description: Assigns a user to an incident as a target or attacker.
commands.name: proofpoint-tr-add-user-to-incident

integration.description: Use the Proofpoint Threat Response integration to orchestrate and automate incident response.
integration.name: Proofpoint Threat Response (Beta)

playbook.description:
This playbook blocks domains using Proofpoint Threat Response.
The playbook checks whether the Proofpoint Threat Response integration is enabled, whether the Domain input has been provided and if so, blocks the domain.
playbook.name: Block Domain - Proofpoint Threat Response

description: Use the Proofpoint Threat Response integration to orchestrate and automate incident response.
name: Proofpoint Threat Response
readme:
